name: porch

mainly UK a covered structure in front of the entrance to a building: For details, see the poster in the church porch. The front porch held pots of flowers, all looking healthy and strong.
GavinD/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
US a raised, covered, sometimes partly closed area, often made of wood, on the front or side of a building: We sat out on the porch to cool off. A cheer rose from those assembled on the porch of the neighbour's house. Synonym
veranda
Jeremy Samuelson/The Image Bank/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe two-bedroom cottage comes with a front porch.He is hoping that folks on his mail route leave their porch lights on tonight.We added a front porch with a wooden deck with exposed wooden support columns.He now just sits on the porch of his farm.
